How do I ban or unban an IP/Subnet in Verus?

You can ban or unban an IP/Subnet in Verus using the `setban` command. This command takes four arguments: the IP/Subnet to ban or unban, the command to add or remove the ban, an optional ban time in seconds, and an optional absolute timestamp in seconds since epoch. Here are examples of banning an IP/Subnet:

```
> verus setban "192.168.0.6" "add" 86400
> verus setban "192.168.0.0/24" "add"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setban", "params": ["192.168.0.6", "add", 86400] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```

To unban an IP/Subnet, simply replace "add" with "remove" in the command.

### `listbanned`
List all banned IPs/Subnets.Examples:
```bash
> verus listbanned
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listbanned", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `ping`
Requests that a ping be sent to all other nodes, to measure ping time.
Results provided in getpeerinfo, pingtime and pingwait fields are decimal seconds.
Ping command is handled in queue with all other commands, so it measures processing backlog, not just network ping.Examples:
```bash
> verus ping
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "ping", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `setban "ip(/netmask)" "add|remove" (bantime) (absolute)`
Attempts add or remove a IP/Subnet from the banned list.#### Arguments:
1. "ip(/netmask)" (string, required) The IP/Subnet (see getpeerinfo for nodes ip) with a optional netmask (default is /32 = single ip)
2. "command"   (string, required) 'add' to add a IP/Subnet to the list, 'remove' to remove a IP/Subnet from the list
3. "bantime"   (numeric, optional) time in seconds how long (or until when if [absolute] is set) the ip is banned (0 or empty means using the default time of 24h which can also be overwritten by the -bantime startup argument)
4. "absolute"   (boolean, optional) If set, the bantime must be a absolute timestamp in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)Examples:
```bash
> verus setban "192.168.0.6" "add" 86400
> verus setban "192.168.0.0/24" "add"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setban", "params": ["192.168.0.6", "add" 86400] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```## Rawtransactions
